name: Newborn Testing
text: This test case describes the forecasting of the DTaP vaccine for a newborn.

name: DTaP #2 at age 10 weeks-5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a second dose of the DTaP vaccine at 10 weeks - 5 days that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: DTaP #2 at 10 wks-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a second dose of the DTaP vaccine at 10 weeks - 4 days that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: DTaP # 2 at age 10 weeks
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a second dose of the DTaP vaccine at 10 weeks that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: DTaP # 2 at age 4 months
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a second dose of the DTaP vaccine at age 4 months, that the dose is valid. Another dose should be forecast.

name: # 2 (Tdap) to child age 7.  DTaP # 1 given before age 12 months.  Forecast # 3 (Td) in 4 weeks.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a Tdap vaccine as a second dose (with a first dose of DTaP vaccine before 12 months of age) that the dose is valid. Another dose should be forecast.

name: # 2 (Tdap) to child age 7.  DTaP # 1 at ≥ 12 months.  Forecast dose 3 for 6 months.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a Tdap vaccine as a second dose (with a first dose of DTaP vaccine at greater than or equal to  12 months of age) that the dose is valid. Another dose should be forecast.

name: # 1 (Td) to # 2 (Tdap) interval 28-4 days in child age > 7 years.  Forecast # 3 in six months.
text: This test case describes when a child 8 years of age is administered a Tdap vaccine as a second dose (and at an interval of 28 -4 days from the first dose) that the dose is valid. Another dose should be forecast.

name: #3 at age 14 weeks-5 days
text: This test case describes when a third dose of the DTaP vaccine is administered at age 14 weeks - 5 days that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: Age 6.  No vaccinations. Forecast DTaP.
text: This test case describes when a child age 6 years has no history of the DTAP/Tdap/Td that the first dose should be forecast.

name: #3 at age 14 weeks-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a third dose of the DTAP/Tdap/Td at age 14 weeks - 4 days that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: #3 at age 14 weeks
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a third dose of the DTAP/Tdap/Td at age 14 weeks that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: #3 at age 6 months
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a third dose of the DTAP/Tdap/Td at age 6 months that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Doses # 2 and #3 at ≥ age 7 years; # 1 at age < 12 mo.  Forecast # 4 in 6 mo.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of DTaP at less than 12 months of age and the second and third dose at greater than 7 years of age that the doses are valid. Another dose should be forecast.

name: Doses # 2 and # 3 at ≥7 years old; dose # 1 at ≥ 12 months old.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of DTaP at greater than 12 months of age and the second and third dose at greater than 7 years of age that the doses are valid. Another dose should be forecast.

name: 1 Tdap, 2 Td with appropriate intervals to child ≥ age 7
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose, of the Diphtheria, Tetanus, and Pertussis vaccine, as Tdap and the second dose as Td at an age greater than 7 years that the doses are valid. Another dose should be forecast.

name: 1 Tdap, 2 Td to child ≥ 7 years old with 6 mo-5 day interval between doses 2 and 3.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the third dose ( first dose was Tdap, second dose was Td) of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 6 months - 5 days from the second dose that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: 1 Tdap, 2 Td to child ≥ 7 years old with 6 mo-4 day interval between doses 2 and 3.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the third dose ( first dose was Tdap, second dose was Td) of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 6 months - 4 days from the second dose that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Age 7.  Two DTaP˂ 12 months old.  Needs Tdap.
text: This test case describes a child who is currently age seven years but was administered two doses of the DTaP vaccine at less than 12 months of age that the doses are valid and that another dose should be forecast (preferably Tdap).

name: Age 7.  No vaccinations.  Forecast Tdap.
text: This test case describes a child  7 years of age with no history of the DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine that a first dose should be forecast.

name: Age 7. Two DTaP˂ 12 mos old & 1 ≥ 12 mo.  Needs Tdap.
text: This test case describes a child who is currently seven years of age but was administered one dose of the DTaP vaccine at less than 12 months of age and another dose at greater than twelve months of age that the doses are valid.  Another dose should be forecast (preferably Tdap).

name: #4 at age 12 mo-5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a fourth dose of the DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at age 12 months - 5 days that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: #4 at age 12 mo-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a fourth dose of the DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at age 12 months - 4 days that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: #4 at age 12 months old
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a fourth dose of the DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at age 12 months that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: #4 at age 4 is UTD until age 11.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a fourth dose of the DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at age 4 years that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: 5 year old with no previous DTP product receives 4 vaccinations prior to age 7 years
text: This test case describes when a child age 5 years has no history of a DTP vaccine that a dose should be forecast.

name: #5 at age 4 years-5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a fifth dose of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 4 years - 5 days that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: #5 at age 4 years-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a fifth dose of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 4 years - 4 days that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: # 5 at age 4 years
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a fifth dose of the DTaP vaccine at an age 4 years that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: DTaP #1 at age 6 weeks-5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a first dose of the DTaP vaccine at 6 weeks - 5 days that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: # 6 DTaP before age 4.  Nothing more until Tdap at age 7 even if some are invalid.
text: This test case describes when a child who is administered a sixth dose of the DTaP vaccine before age 4 that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: Adolescent with Td but no Tdap.
text: This test case describes when an adolescent is administered Td as a sixth dose that another dose (preferably Tdap) should be forecast.

name: Invalid age for dose # 1 in first of series
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a first dose of the DTaP vaccine at an invalid age but repeats the dose at three months later and the dose is valid. Another dose should be administered.

name: Invalid age for  dose # 2 in midst of others
text: This test case describes when a child is administered an invalid second dose of the DTaP vaccine but a repeat is given at an appropriate interval that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Invalid age for dose #3 in midst of others
text: This test case describes when a child is administered an invalid third dose of the DTaP vaccine but a repeat is administered at an appropriate age and interval that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Invalid age for dose # 4 in midst of others
text: This test case describes when a child is administered an invalid fourth dose of the DTaP vaccine but a repeat is administered at an appropriate age and interval that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Invalid age dose 5 in midst of others
text: This test case describes when a child is administered an invalid fifth dose of the DTaP vaccine but a repeat is administered at an appropriate age and interval that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28-5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a second dose of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 28-5 days after the first dose, that the dose is not valid. A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a second dose of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 28-4 days after the first dose, that the dose is valid. Another dose should be forecast.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a second dose of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 28 days after the first dose, that the dose is valid. Another dose should be forecast.

name: DTaP #1 at age 6 weeks-4 days
text: This test case describes when a patient is administered a first dose of the DTaP vaccine at 6 weeks- 4 days that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Dose 2 to dose 3 interval 28-5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered dose three of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 28 -5 days after the second dose that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: Dose 2 to dose 3 interval 28-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered dose three of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 28 - 4 days after the second dose that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Dose 2 to dose 3 interval 28 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered dose three of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 28 days after the second dose that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Dose 3 to dose 4 interval 6 months-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered dose four of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 6 months - 4 days months after the third dose that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Dose 3 to dose 4 interval 6 months
text: This test case describes when a child is administered dose four of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 6 months after the third dose that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Dose 3 to dose 4 interval 4 months
text: This test case describes when a child is administered dose four of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of 4 months after the third dose that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Invalid dose 1 to dose 2 interval in midst of other vaccines
text: This test case describes when a child is administered an invalid second dose of the DTaP vaccine at an interval less than 4 weeks - 4 days but was administered a valid repeat and third dose that the doses are valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Invalid dose 2 to dose 3 interval in midst of other vaccines.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered an invalid third dose of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of less than 4 weeks - 4 days but was administered a valid repeat.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: DTaP #1 at age 6 weeks
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a first dose of the DTaP vaccine at 6 weeks of age that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Invalid dose 3 to dose 4 interval in midst of other vaccinations
text: This test case describes when a child is administered an invalid fourth dose of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of less than 4 months - 4 days that a repeat dose should be forecast.

name: Invalid dose 4 to dose 5 interval in midst of others
text: This test case describes when a child is administered an invalid fifth dose of the DTaP vaccine at an interval of less than 6 months - 4 days but was administered another valid dose at age 11 years.  A decennial dose should be forecast.

name: Tdap as dose #1
text: This test case describes when a child has been administered an invalid Tdap vaccine dose as the first dose but has received a valid repeat and valid second and third DTaP doses.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Tdap as dose #2
text: This test case describes when a child has been administered an invalid Tdap vaccine dose as the second dose but has received a valid repeat and valid third DTaP doses.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Tdap as dose 3 to child under age 4=invalid as DTaP 3
text: This test case describes when a child is administered an invalid third dose of the DTaP vaccine as Tdap that a repeat dose (DTaP) should be forecast.

name: Tdap as dose 4 to age 15 months=valid as DTaP
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Tdap as a fourth dose at age 15 months that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Tdap as dose 5 to age 4 years-5 days=invalid as dose 5 of DTaP
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Tdap as a fifth at age 4 years - 5 days that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: Tdap as dose 5 to age 4-4 days. Counts as valid DTaP.  Child will need another Tdap in adolescence.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Tdap as a fifth at age 4 years - 4 days that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast at age 11 years.

name: Tdap as dose 5 to age 4 years old=valid as DTaP 5.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Tdap as a fifth at age 4 years that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast at age 11 years.

name: Tdap as dose 1 at age 7 years old
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Tdap at age 7 years as the first dose that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: DTaP # 1 at age 2 months
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a first of the DTaP vaccine at 2 months of age that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Tdap as dose 2 at age ≥7 years
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Tdap at age 7 years as the second dose that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Tdap as dose 3 to ≥ 7 years old
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Tdap at age 7 years as the third dose that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Tdap at age 7 years-5 days. Current age 7 years
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Tdap at age 7 years - 5 days as a first dose that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: Tdap at age 11 to child up-to-date with DTaP
text: This test case describes when a child is up-to-date on DTaP vaccinations and is administered a Tdap dose at age 11 years  that the dose is valid.  The decennial dose should be forecast.

name: 4 doses of Tetramune to child
text: This test case describes when a child is administered 4 valid doses of DTaP (Tetramune) that another dose should be forecast.

name: 4 doses of Tetramune with a DTaP booster.  Forecast Tdap.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered 5 valid doses of DTaP that another dose should be forecast.

name: 4 Tetramune and Tdap at age 11=UTD for 10 years
text: This test case describes when a child was administered 4 previous valid doses of DTaP (Tetramune) at appropriate ages and intervals and a Tdap dose at 11 years of age that another dose (decennial) should be forecast.

name: DTaP #1 at age 6.5 years.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of DTaP at age 6.5 years that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: TriHibit as primary dose.  DTaP=valid.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of DTaP (TriHibit) that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: TriHibit as valid dose 4 of DTaP
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the fourth dose of DTaP (TriHibit) that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: TriHibit as valid dose 5 of DTaP
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the fifth dose of DTaP (TriHibit) that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Pentavalente (Mexico) DTaP/IPV/HIB counts as valid.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered  4 doses of Pentavalente (Mexico) at appropriate intervals and age that the doses are valid.  Another DTaP (U.S) dose should be forecast.

name: Kinrix at age 2 months as Dose 1 of DTaP.  Off label but valid.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a dose of Kinrix as the first dose of the DTaP vaccine series, at two months of age, that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Kinrix at age 4 months as dose 2 of DTaP.  Off label but valid.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a dose of Kinrix as a second dose of DTaP in the vaccine series, at four months of age, that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Kinrix at age 6 months as dose 3 of DTaP.  Off label but valid.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a dose of Kinrix as a third dose of DTaP in the vaccine series, at six months of age, that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Kinrix at age 12 months as dose 4 of DTaP=valid
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a dose of Kinrix as a fourth dose of DTaP in the vaccine series, at twelve months of age, that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Kinrix at age 4 to child with appropriate DTaP=UTD until adolescence
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a dose of Kinrix at age four years,that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Kinrix at age 4 years-5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a dose of Kinrix at age 4 years - 5 days,that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: DTaP # 1 at age 7 years (off label but counts as valid).
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a dose of DTaP vaccine at age seven years,that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Kinrix at age 4 years -4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a dose of Kinrix at age 4 years - 4 days,that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Newborn forecasting
text: This test case describes the forecasting of the DTaP vaccine for a newborn.

name: # 2 Pediarix at 6 yrs 11.5 mo
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Pediarix as the second dose of the DTaP vaccine at age 6 years 11.5 months that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: # 2 Pediarix at 7 yrs; # 1 at less than 12 mo.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Pediarix as the second dose of the DTaP vaccine at age 7 years and a first dose at less than 12 months that the dose valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: # 2 Pediarix at 7 yrs; # 1 ≥ 12 mo. Need 6 mo interval from 2 to 3.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Pediarix as the second dose of the DTaP vaccine at age 7 years and a first dose at greater than 12 months that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: # 1 and 2 Pediarix at ≥7 yrs  with 28 day interval.  Off label but does not need repeating.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Pediarix as the first and second dose of the DTaP series with a 28 day interval that the doses are valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: # 3 Pediarix at 14 wks-5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Pediarix as the third dose of DTaP at age 14 weeks - 5 days that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: # 3 Pediarix at 14 wks-4 days.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Pediarix as the third dose of DTaP at age 14 weeks - 4 days that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: #3 Pediarix at age 24 weeks- 5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Pediarix as the third dose of DTaP at age 24 weeks - 5 days that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: # 3 Pediarix at 6 yrs 11.5 mo
text: This test case describes that when a child has received three doses of the DTaP vaccine and the first dose was administered at 12 months or older, and the third dose was administered prior to age 7, that another dose should be forecast at age 7.

name: # 4 Pediarix at 1 yr -5 days.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Pediarix as the fourth dose of DTaP at age 1 yr - 5 days that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: # 1 Pediarix at 6 wks-5 days
text: This test case describes when a patient is administered Pediarix as a first dose of the DTaP vaccine at age 6 weeks- 5 days that the dose is not valid.  A repeat dose should be forecast.

name: # 4 Pediarix at 1 yr -4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered Pediarix as the fourth dose of DTaP at age 1 yr - 4 days that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: # 5 Pediarix at 7 yrs.  Off label but valid.
Invalid age dose 1 as first of others.
Invalid age dose 2 in midst of others
invalid age dose 3 in midst of others
invalid dose 1-2 interval in midst of others
invalid dose 2-3 interval in midst of others
invalid dose 3-4 interval in midst of others
text: This test case describes when the fourth dose of DTaP is administered at less than 4 months - 4 days from dose #3, that the dose is not valid.

name: # 2 Pentacel at 6 yrs 11.5 mo. Off label but counts. Current Age 7 years
# 2 Pentacel at 7 yrs; # 1 at age < 12 mo
# 2 Pentacel at 7 yrs; # 1 at age ≥ 12 mo.
# 4 Pentacel at 5 yrs=off label but counts.

# 2 Pentacel at 6 yrs .  Off label but counts.
Dose #1 received at 4 months, dose #2 received at 8 months, dose #3 received at 2 years, and dose #4 received at 3 years. Current Age is 7 yrs.
Dose #1 received at 2 years, dose #2 received at 3 years, and dose #3 received at 4 years. Current age 7 yrs
3 Dose received at < 12 months.  Current age is 7 years.
Dose #1 given at < 12 months. Current age is 7.
Dose #1 given at 3 months, dose #2 given at 1 year, dose #3 given at 2 years, and dose # 4 given at 3years. Current age is 7 yrs
Dose #1 given at 5 months, dose #2 given at 1 year, dose #3 given at 2 years. Current age is 7 yrs
Dose #1 at 9 months, dose #2 at 2 years, and dose #3 at 5 years. Current Age is 7 yrs
Dose 1 given at < 12 mo Dose 2 given at 2 yrs Current age 7 yrs
3 doses at < 12 mos, 1 dose at 1.5 yrs. Current Age is 7 yrs.
Dose 1 and 2 given at < 12 months of age. Dose # 3 given at 2 years and dose #4 given at 3 years. Current age is 7 years.
DTaP - Dose 3 to dose 4 interval 4 months-4 days
text: This test case describes when  dose #4 of DTaP is administered at least 4 months -4 days from Dose #3 that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: DTaP - Dose 3 to dose 4 interval 4 months-5 days
text: This test case describes when  dose #4 of DTaP is administered at least 4 months -5 days from Dose #3 that the dose is not valid.

name: Decennial dose as Tdap.
text: This test case describes when a patient receives Tdap as the decennial dose, that the dose is considered to be valid and another dose should be forecast.

name: Adult with no previous dose of the Tdap vaccine
text: This test case describes when a patient has no previous doses of the tetanus, diphtheria, or pertussis vaccines, that the first dose should be forecast.

name: Adult patient with dose #1 of DTaP/Tdap/Td
text: This test case describes when a patient has received the first dose of the DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine that another dose should be forecast.

name: Adult patient with dose #2 of DTaP/Tdap/Td at 4 weeks
text: This test case describes when a patient has received the second dose of  DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at 4 weeks that another dose should be forecast.

name: Adult patient with dose #2 of DTaP/Tdap/Td at 4 weeks - 4 days
text: This test case describes when a patient has received the second dose of DTap/Tdap/Td vaccine at 4 weeks - 4 days that the dose should be considered valid and that another dose should be forecast.

name: Adult patient with dose #2 of DTaP/Tdap/Td at 4 weeks - 5 days
text: This test case describes when a patient has received the second dose of DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at 4 weeks - 5 days that the dose should not be considered to be valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Adult patient with dose #3 of Td at 6 mos
text: This test case describes when a patient has received the third dose of DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at 6 months that the dose is considered to be valid.  Forecast another dose.

name: Adult patient with dose #3 of Td at 6 mos - 4 days
text: This test case describes when a patient has received the third dose of DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at 6 months - 4 days that the dose is considered to be valid.  Forecast another dose.

name: Adult patient with dose #3 of Td at 6 mos - 5 days
text: This test case describes when a patient has received the third dose of DTaP/Tdap/Td vaccine at 6 months - 5 days that the dose is not valid.  Forecast a repeat dose.

name: Newborn
text: This test case describes when assessing a newborn for the first dose of the Influenza vaccine that it should be administered at the recommended age of 6 months.

name: # 1 to # 2 interval 28 days
text: This test case describes when a newborn receives the first dose of the Influenza vaccine at 6 months and a second dose at 28 days later that the next dose of influenza is recommended at the next seasonal flu begin date.

name: Child under 9 needs two in first season
text: This test case describes when a child under the age of 9 receives dose 1 of the influenza vaccine in his first season, that a second dose is recommended at 4 weeks later.

name: Child under 9 received only one in first season
text: This test case describes when a child under the age of 9 receives only one influenza dose in his first season, that a second dose is recommended at 4 weeks later.

name: Child under 9 received two in first season
text: This test case describes when a child under 9 years of age receives two doses of the Influenza vaccine in his first season, that no additional doses are needed during that season.

name: Invalid dose 1st season
text: This test case describes when a child receives his first dose of the influenza vaccine before the age of 6 months, that the dose is not valid and should be repeated at the recommended age.

name: # 1 at 6 mo-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child receives his first dose of the influenza vaccine at 6 months - 4 days, that the dose is considered to be valid, and the next dose should be forecasted.

name: # 1 at 6 mo
text: This test case describes when a child receives his first dose of the Influenza vaccine at 6 months of age, that the dose is considered to be valid, and the second dose should be forecasted.

name: # 1 to # 2 interval 23 days
text: This test case describes when a child receives the second dose of the Influenza vaccine at less than 4 weeks - 4 days from the previous dose, that the dose is not valid and a repeat dose should be recommended at 4 weeks later.

name: # 1 to # 2 interval 24 days
text: This test case describes when a child receives the second dose of the influenza vaccine 24 days after the first dose, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Child under 9 received one in previous season and one in current season
text: This test case describes when a child under 9 years of age received one dose of the Influenza vaccine in a previous season and one in the current season that an additional dose is recommended in the current season. Forecast second dose at 4 weeks later.

name: Patient 9 years or older with no current seasonal dose
text: This test case describes when a patient is 9 years or older and does not have a current seasonal dose that a dose should be forecast.

name: Patient 9 years or older with one current seasonal dose
text: This test case describes when a patient is 9 years or older and has been administered a dose of the flu vacccine in the current season that no additional doses should be forecast for the season.

name: Child under 9 years with dose in current season and two doses in previous different seasons
text: This test case describes when a child under 9 years of age receives a flu vaccine in the current season and two vaccine doses in previous different season, that the series is complete for the season.

name: Child received first dose at 9 years.  Series complete
text: This test case describes when a child age 9 years is administered a first dose of the Flu vaccine that no additional doses are needed.  Series is complete for season.

name: Child entered season at 8 years of age, received dose before 9. Forecast another dose
text: This test case describes when a child enters the flu season at age 8 years, received their first dose, but is now 9 years old. Per 2019-20 ACIP flu recommendations, the patient needs a second dose.

name: Adult with no previous dose of the Influenza vaccine
text: This test case describes when an adult patient has not received any doses of the influenza vaccine, that a dose should be forecast.

name: Adult with a dose of the influenza vaccine
text: This test case describes when an adult patient has received a dose of the  influenza vaccine, that no additional doses are needed. Series is complete for the season.

name: Infant forecasting
text: This test case describes when assessing a newborn for the first dose of the 2-dose Hep A vaccine that it is not recommended until at least 12 months of age.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 6 months.  Series complete.

name: Adult dose mistakenly given to a child.  Counts as valid.

text: This test case describes when a third dose is administered at least 6 months after the first dose, that the dose is considered to be valid.  The series is complete. The invalid dose (2nd dose administered) is not considered in the spacing.

text: This test case describes when a adolescent child is administered a third dose of the HPV vaccine at 12 weeks after the second dose and at least 16 weeks - 4 days from dose number one, that the dose is considered to be valid.  The series is complete. (Prior to 12/16/16, 16 weeks - 4 days was allowed to be used as an Absolute Minimum Interval from Target Dose #1).

name: # 2 to # 3 interval 12 wks-4 days
text: This test case describes when an adolescent child is administered a third dose of the HPV vaccine at 12 weeks - 4 days after the second dose and at least 5 months from dose number one, that the dose is considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: Invalid dose 1 of three doses given
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a first dose of the HPV vaccine at less than 9 years - 4 days, but receives a second and third dose of the vaccine at valid intervals and age, that the doses are considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: Invalid dose 2 in midst of others
text: This test case describes when a child is administered a second dose of the HPV vaccine too soon, but receives a third dose of the vaccine 12 weeks from the previous dose and at least 5 months from the first dose that the doses are considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: Adult female age 27 years, No Doses
text: This test case describes when an adult patient has no history of the HPV vaccine and is at age 27 that no doses should be forecast. The patient has aged out.

name: Male age 27. HPV not recommended.
text: This test case describes when an adult patient has no history of the HPV vaccine and is at age 27 that no doses should be forecast. The patient has aged out.

name: Female, age 14.  HPV recommended
text: This test case describes when an adolescent, age 14 years, has no history of the HPV vaccine that the first dose should be forecast.

name: HPV bivalent to male adolescent. Not valid. Forecast quadrivalent
text: This test case describes when an invalid vaccine is administered (Cervarix) that a repeat dose should be administered as soon as possible.

name: # 1 at age 9 years-5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered dose number one of the HPV vaccine at 9 years - 5 days that the dose is not valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: # 1 at age  9 years-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the HPV vaccine at 9 years - 4 days that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: # 1 at age 9 years
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the HPV vaccine at 9 years that the dose is valid.  Another dose should be forecast.

name: Female age 26, No HPV doses
text: This test case describes when an adult age 26 years has no history of the HPV vaccine that the first dose should be forecast.

name: Adolescent child with first dose of HPV vaccine at 13 years and second dose after 15 years of age.
text: This test case describes when an adolescent child has received the first dose of the HPV vaccine at 13 years and a second dose 2 years later that the doses are valid.  The series is complete.

name: Adolescent child age 15 with no previous doses.
text: This test case describes when an adolescent child age 15 years has no previous history of the HPV vaccine that the first dose should be forecast.

name: Adolescent child age 15 with one dose of the HPV vaccine
text: This test case describes when an adolescent child age 15 years has been administered the first dose of the HPV vaccine that another dose should be forecast.

name: Adolescent child age 15 with two previous doses of the HPV vaccine.
text: This test case describes when an adolescent age 15 years old has been administered a first and second dose of the HPV vaccine that another dose should be forecast.

name: Adolescent child age 15 with three doses of the HPV vaccine
text: This test case describes when an adolescent child age 15 years old has been administered all three doses of the HPV vaccine at valid intervals that the doses are valid.   The series is complete.

name: Adolescent child with a history of 2 doses of the HPV vaccine 1st dose given at 11 years and the 2nd dose give at 2 months later.
Adolescent child 15 years -1 days with no previous history of HPV vaccine
text: This test case describes when an adolescent child age 15 years - 1 day has no previous history of the HPV vaccine that the first dose should be forecast.

name: Adolescent child age 11 with 2nd dose of HPV at 5 months - 5 days
text: This test case describes when a second dose is administered at an interval of 4 weeks -4 days but before 5 months that a repeat dose  should be forecasted.

name: Adolescent child age 11 with 2nd dose of HPV at 5 months - 4 days
text: This test case describes when an adolescent child age 11 years old is administered the second dose of the the HPV vaccine at 5 months - 4 days that the dose is valid.  The series is complete.

name: Child is age 9 with 3rd dose of HPV at 5 months from first dose
text: This test case describes when a third dose is administered an at an interval at least 5 months from the first dose and 12 weeks from the previous dose that no further doses are recommended.  Series is complete.

name: Any dose 26 years, Male, gardasil
text: This test case describes when a male receives the first dose of the HPV vaccine at age 26 years that a second dose should be forecast.

name: Male age 26, No HPV doses
text: This test case describes when a male, age 26 years has no previous doses of the HPV vaccine that the first dose should be forecast.

name: #1 @ 11 yrs, 0 days, MCV4
text: This test case describes when dose 1 of a Mening vaccine is given at 11 years that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: #2 @ 16 yr - 4 days, MCV4
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of a Mening vaccine is given at 16 years - 4 days, that the dose is considered valid.  The series is complete.

name: #2 @ 10 16 yr - 5 days, MCV4
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of a Mening vaccine is given at 16 years - 5 days, that the dose is considered invalid.

name: #2 @ 16 years, MCV4
text: This test case describes when dose #1 and dose #2 of a Mening vaccine are administered at the recommended ages (11 and 16 years), that the doses are considered valid.  The series is complete.

name: #2 with interval of 5 years of #1
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of a Mening vaccine is administered 5 years after dose #1 (age 13), that the dose in considered valid. The series is complete.

name: #1 @ 10 yrs - 1 day, #2 @ 10 yrs + 8 weeks - 5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of a Mening vaccine is administered before 10 years of age and a repeat dose is administered at one month + 20 days later that the dose is considered valid.

name: #1 @ 10 yrs - 1 day, #2 @ 10 yrs + 8 weeks
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of a Mening vaccine is administered at 10 years - 1 day and a repeat dose is administered at one month + 25 days later that the dose is considered valid.

name: #1 @ 10 yrs, MCV4
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of a Mening vaccine is administered at age 10 years + 0 months that the dose is considered valid.

name: #1 @ 10 yrs - 1 day, MCV4
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of a Mening vaccine is administered at 10 years-1 day that the dose is considered invalid.

name: #1 @ 10 yrs - 1 day, #2 @ 10 yrs, 8 weeks - 4 days
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of a Mening vaccine is administered at 10 years - 1 day and a repeat dose is administered at one month + 21 days later that the dose is considered valid.

name: 10 year old
text: This test case describes when a newborn is assessed for the first dose of a Mening that a CDS engine should forecast the dose at the recommended age.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 8 wks-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of a Mening vaccine is administered too early (8 weeks - 5 days after dose #1), that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 8 wks-4 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of a Mening vaccine is administered at an interval of 8 wks - 4 days from dose #1 (age 15 years + 11 months) that the dose is considered valid.  The series is complete.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 8 weeks
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of a Mening vaccine is administered at an interval of 8 wks from dose #1 (age 15 years + 11 months) that the dose is considered valid.  The series is complete.

name: # 1 at age 11 years
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of a Mening vaccine is administered at age 11 years + 0 days that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: age 22.  No doses; No forecast
text: This test case describes when an individual, age 22 years, is assessed for the first dose of a Mening vaccine that a CDS engine should not forecast a dose.  A dose is not recommended. The series status is Aged Out.

name: # 1 at age 15 years
text: This test case describes when the first dose of a Mening vaccine is administered at 15 years + 8 days, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: # 1 at age 16 years -5 days
text: This test case describes when a first dose of a Mening vaccine is administered at 16 years - 5 days that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: # 1 at age 16 years -4 days
text: This test case describes when a dose of a Mening vaccine is administered at 16 years - 4 days, that the dose is considered to be valid. The series is complete.

name: # 1 at age 16 years
text: This test case describes when a dose of a Mening vaccine is administered at 16 years + 0 days, that the dose is considered to be valid. The series is complete.

name: #1 at 15 months
text: This test case describes when a child receives the first dose of the MMR vaccine at 15 months of age, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: #2 at 4 years
text: This test case describes when the second dose of the MMR vaccine is administered at 4 years of age, that the dose is considered valid.  The series is complete.

name: #1 at 7 years
text: This test case describes when a child receives the first dose of the MMR vaccine at 7 years, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: 5 single antigen doses: 1 Measles; 2 Mumps; 2 Rubella
text: This test case describes when a child is administered  single antigen doses of Measles, Mumps, and Rubella, at the minimum age of 12 months and a second dose of the Mumps and Rubella antigens at 5 years of age, that the second dose of the Measles vaccine is recommended.

name: 4 single antigen doses: 1 Measles; 2 Mumps; 1 Rubella
text: This test case describes when a child is administered single antigen doses of Measles, Mumps, and Rubella, at the minimum age of 12 months and a second dose of the Mumps antigen at 5 years of age, that the second dose of the Measles and Rubella vaccine is recommended.

name: 1 single antigen dose at 12M: 1 Measles
text: This test case describes when a child is administered single antigen dose of Measles, at the minimum age of 12 months that the a second dose is recommended.

name: 2 single antigen doses: 1 Measles; 1 Mumps
text: This test case describes when a child is administered single antigen dose of Measles and Mumps, at the minimum age of 12 months, that the second dose of the vaccines is recommended.

name: 7 single antigen doses: 2 Measles; 3 Mumps; 2 Rubella
text: This test case describes when a child is administered single antigen doses of Measles, Mumps, and Rubella at the minimum age of 12 months, a second dose of the Measles, Mumps, and Rubella antigens at 5 years of age, and an inadvertentent dose of the Mumps vaccine that the series is complete.

name: 3 single antigen doses: 1 Measles; 1 Mumps; 1 Rubella
text: This test case describes when a child is administered single antigen doses of Measles, Mumps, and Rubella, at the minimum age of 12 months, that a second doses of the vaccines are recommended.

name: 3 single antigen doses on same day: 1 Measles; 1 Mumps; 1 Rubella
text: This test case describes when a child is administered single antigen doses of Measles, Mumps, and Rubella, at the minimum age of 12 months, on the same day, that a second dose of the vaccines are recommended.

name: 6 single antigen doses: 2 Measles; 2 Mumps; 2 Rubella
text: This test case describes when a child is administered single antigen doses of Measles, Mumps, and Rubella at the minimum age of 12 months, a second dose of the Measles, Mumps, and Rubella antigens at 5 years of age, that the series is complete.

name: 3 single antigen doses: 2 Measles; 1 Rubella
text: This test case describes when a child is administered single antigen dose of Measles and Rubella, at the minimum age of 12 months, and a second dose of the Measles vaccine  at least 4 weeks later, that a second dose of the Rubella vaccine is recommended.

name: MMR # 1 at 12 months-5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the MMR vaccine before 12 months of age, that the dose is not valid.

name: MMR # 1 at 12 months-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the MMR vaccine at 12 months - 4 days, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: MMR # 1 at 12 months
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the MMR vaccine at 12 months, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Newborn forecasting
text: This test case describes the forecasting of the first dose of the MMR vaccine for a newborn.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28 days
text: This test case describes when the second dose of the MMR vaccine is administered to a 2 year old child at 28 days after the first dose, that the dose is considered to be valid. The series is complete.

name: MMR and VZ given at age 12 months
text: This test case describes when a dose of the Varicella vaccine is administered at the same time of a MMR vaccine, both are valid.

name: Doses 1 and 2 of MMR and VZ at ages 12 and 13 months
text: This test case describes when the first doses of the MMR  and Varicella vaccines are administered at 12 months of age, and the second doses of those vaccines are administered at 13 months of age, that the doses are considered to be valid.  The series are complete.

name: VZ to MMR interval 28-1 day = invalid MMR
text: This test case describes when the first doses of the Varicella vaccine is administered at 12 months of age, and the first dose of the MMR vaccine is administered at an interval of 28-1 day that the MMR vaccine dose is not valid.

name: VZ given at age 12 mo; MMR at age 12 mo+28 days
text: This test case describes when the first dose of the Varicella vaccine is administered at 12 months of age and the first dose of the MMR vaccine is administered at 28 days later, that the doses are considered to be valid.

name: Dose 1 MMRV at 12 m-5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the MMR vaccine (ProQuad) at 12 months -5 days, that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose 1 MMRV at 12 m-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the MMR vaccine (ProQuad) at 12 months -4 days, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 MMRV interval 28 days age < 15 months old= valid MMR
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the MMR vaccine (ProQuad) at 12 months and the second dose at 28 days later,  that the doses are considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: Dose 1 to 2 MMRV interval 28 days in child ≥ 15 months old=valid MMR
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the MMR vaccine (ProQuad) at 3 years of age and the second dose at 28 days later,  that the doses are considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: Dose 1 to 2 MMRV interval 28-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the MMR vaccine (ProQuad) at 13 months of age and the second dose at 24 days later, that the second dose is not valid.

name: MMR to MMRV interval 28 days=valid MMR # 2
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the MMR vaccine at 12 months of age and the second dose (ProQuad) at 28 days later,  that the doses are considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: MMR to MMRV interval 24 days=not valid MMR # 2
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the MMR vaccine at 12 months of age and the second dose (ProQuad) at 24 days later,  that the second dose is not valid.

name: MMRV to MMR interval 28 days=valid MMR dose 2
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the MMR vaccine (ProQuad) at 13 months of age and the second dose (MMR II) at 28 days later,  that the doses are considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 4 wks between VZ and MMRV in any age child=valid MMR
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the Varicella vaccine at 12 months of age and a dose of the MMRV vaccine at 4 weeks later, that the doses are considered to be valid.

name: 28 day interval between invalid VZ and subsequent MMRV=valid MMR and VZ
text: This test case describes when the first dose of the Varicella vaccine is administered before 12 months - 4 days and a MMRV vaccine is administered at 28 days later, that the MMRV (PRoQuad) vaccine dose is considered to be valid.

name: Interval of < 24 days between an invalid MMR and a subsequent MMRV=no valid MMR's
text: This test case describes when the first dose of the MMR vaccine is administered before 12 months - 4 days and a MMRV vaccine (ProQuad)  is administered less than 28 days later, that neither are the doses are valid.

name: Interval of < 24 days between an invalid VZ and a subsequent MMRV=no valid MMR or VZ
text: This test case describes when the first dose of the Varicella vaccine is administered before 12 months - 4 days and a MMRV (ProQuad) vaccine is administered less than 28 days later, that the doses are not valid.

name: Correctly administered single antigen M, M and R followed by MMR=series complete
text: This test case describes when single antigens M, M, and R are administered to a child >  12 months of age followed by a MMR (4rth )dose a year later, that the doses are considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: Dose 2 at age 13 mo -5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the second dose of the MMR vaccine at 13 months - 5 days, that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose 2 at age 13 mo - 4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the second dose of the MMR vaccine at 13 months - 4 days, that the dose is considered to be valid. The series is complete.

name: Dose 2 at age 13 mo
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the second dose of the MMR vaccine at 13 months, that the dose is considered to be valid. The series is complete.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28 days-5 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the second dose of the MMR vaccine at an interval of 28 -5 days, that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28-4 days
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the second dose of the MMR vaccine at an interval of 28 -4 days, that the dose is considered to be valid. The series is complete.

name: MMR: Patient is born before 01/01/1957
text: This test case describes when a patient was born before January 1, 1957, that the patient is considered to be Immune.

name: Adult with no previous doses of the MMR vaccine
text: This test cases describes when an adult patient has no known history of the MMR vaccine that a dose should be forecast.

name: Adult with a dose of the MMR vaccine
text: This test case describes when an adult patient received a dose of the MMR vaccine, that no additional doses are needed. Series is complete.

name: Adolescent with no dose of MMR vaccine
text: This test case describes when an adolescent patient has no known history of the MMR vaccine that a dose should be forecast.

name: Adolescent with 2nd dose of MMR vaccine at 4 weeks
text: This test case describes when a patient receives the 2nd dose of the MMR vaccine at 4 weeks after the first dose, that the dose is considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: Adolescent with 2nd dose of MMR vaccine at 4 weeks - 5 days
text: This test case describes when a patient is administered the second dose of the MMR vaccine at less than 4 weeks - 4 days, that another dose should be forecast.

name: Adolescent with 2nd dose of MMR vaccine at 4 weeks - 4 days
text: This test case describes when a patient receives the 2nd dose of the MMR vaccine at 4 weeks - 4 days after the first dose, that the dose is considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: Newborn Testing
text: This test case describes the forecasting of a newborn for the first dose of the Pneumoccocal vaccine.

name: Dose # 1 PCV 13 at age 18 months
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at age 18 months that the dose is considered to be valid and the patient is on a catch-up schedule.

name: Dose # 1 of PCV 7 at age 24 months.  Need one dose PCV 13.
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of the Pneumococcal 7 vaccine is administered at age 24 months that the dose is considered to be valid. Forecast another dose.

name: Dose # 1 of PCV 13 at age 24 months.  Series complete.
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at age 24 months that the dose is considered to be valid.  No additional dose should be forecasted.  The series is complete.

name: Dose # 2 PCV 13 at age 10 weeks-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at  age 10 weeks - 5 days, that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose # 2 PCV 13 at age 10 weeks-4 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at  age 10 weeks - 4 days, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose PCV 13 # 2 at age 10 weeks
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at  age 10 weeks, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose # 2 PCV 13 at age 4 months
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at  age 4 months, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose # 1 PCV 13 at  age 7 months, dose # 2 at age 8 mos and current age ≥ 12 mos.
text: This test case describes when a child is currently 12 months of age and was administered dose #1 at age 7 months and dose #2 at age 8 months of age that the doses are considered to be valid. A final dose is recommended at age 12 months.

name: Dose # 1 PCV 13 at 12 mo; dose # 2 at 1 yr 8 wks-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at 12 months, and the #2 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at 1 yr, 8 weeks - 5 days, that the second dose is not valid.

name: Dose # 1 PCV 13 at age 12 mos; # 2 at 1 yr 8 wks-4 days
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at 12 months, and the #2 dose of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at 1 yr, 8 weeks - 4 days, that the second dose is valid. The patient is complete.

name: Dose # 1 PCV 13 at age 12 months; # 2 at age 14 mos.  Series complete.
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at 12 months, and the #2 dose of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at 14 months, that the second dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose # 1 PCV 13 at 24 mo-5 days.  Valid but child needs another.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first dose of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine at 24 months - 5 days, that the dose is considered to be valid, but a second dose is still needed.

name: Dose 1 PCV 13 at 24 m-4 days.  Series complete.
text: This test case describes when a child is administered the first  dose of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine at 24 months - 4 days, that the dose is considered to be valid. No additional doses are recommended.  The series is complete.

name: Dose # 3 PCV 13 at age 14 weeks-5 days.
text: This test case describes when dose #3 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered to a child at 14 weeks- 5 days, that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose # 3 PCV 13 at age 14 weeks-4 days.
text: This test case describes when dose #3 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered to a child at 14 weeks- 4 days, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose # 3 PCV 13 at age 14 weeks
text: This test case describes when dose #3 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered to a child at 14 weeks, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose # 3 PCV 13 at 6 mo.
text: This test case describes when dose #3 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered to a child at 6 months, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Mixed vaccines: dose # 1 PCV 7 at 6 mo; # 2 PCV 13 at 8 mo; # 3 PCV 13 at 12 months.  Series complete.
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of PCV 7 is administered at 6 months, dose #2 of PCV 13 is administered at 8 months, and dose #3 of PCV 13 is administered at 12 months, that the doses are considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: Mixed vaccines: dose # 1 PCV 7 at 7 mo; # 2 PCV 7 at 8 mo; #3 PCV 13 at 12 months.  Series complete.
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of PCV 7 is administered at 7 months, dose #2 of PCV 13 is administered at 8 months, and dose #3 of PCV 13 is administered at 12 months, that the doses are considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: Dose # 1 PCV 13 at age 6 weeks-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of the Pneumococcal vaccine is administered at age 6 weeks - 5 days that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose # 1 PCV 13 at 6 mo; # 2 at 11 mo, # 3 at 12 mo
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of PCV 13 is administered at 6 months, dose #2 of PCV 13 is administered at 11 months, and dose #3 of PCV 13 is administered at 12 months, that dose #3 is not valid.

name: Dose # 4 PCV 13 at age 12 mo-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #4 of the PCV13 vaccine is administered at age 12 months - 5 days that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose # 4 PCV 13 at age 12 months-4 days.  Series complete.
text: This test case describes when dose #4 of the PCV13 vaccine is administered at age 12 months - 4 days that the dose is considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: Dose # 4 PCV 13 at 1 year.  Series complete.
text: This test case describes when dose #4 of the PCV13 vaccine is administered at age 12 months that the dose is considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: 4 doses of PCV 7, no PCV 13.  Needs one PCV 13.
text: This test case describes when 4 doses of PCV 7 is administered that one dose of Pneumococcal 13 is needed.

name: Dose 1 invalid (age) as first of others
text: This test case describes when the first dose of the Pneumococcal vaccine is  not valid.

name: Dose 2 invalid (age) in midst of others.
text: This test case describes when the second dose of the Pneumococcal vaccine is  not valid.

name: Dose # 3 invalid (age) in midst of others.   Four valid doses not required in this scenario.
text: This test case describes when the third dose of the Pneumococcal vaccine is  not valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28-5 days.
text: This test case describes when the interval between dose #1 and dose #2 of the Pnuemococal vaccine is 28 - 5 days that the second dose is not valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28-4 days
text: This test case describes when dose #1 and dose #2 of the Pnuemococal 13 vaccine is administered at  28 - 4 days that the second dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose # 1 PCV 13 at age 6 weeks-4 days
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at 6 weeks - 4 days that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose 1 PCV 13 to dose 2 interval 28 days
text: This test case describes when dose #1 to dose #2 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at an interval of 28 days, that the second dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose 2 to dose 3  interval  28-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 to dose #3 of the Pnuemococcal 13 vaccine is administered at 28-5 days that dose #3 is not valid.

name: Dose 2 to dose 3 PCV 13 interval 28-4 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 to dose #3 of the Pnuemococcal 13 vaccine is administered at an interval of 28-4 days that dose #3 is considered to be valid.

name: Dose 2 to dose 3 PCV 13 interval 28 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 to dose #3 of the Pnuemococcal vaccine is administered at an interval of 28 days that dose #3 is considered to be valid.

name: Dose 3 PCV 13 to dose 4 interval 8 weeks-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #3 to dose #4 of the Pnuemococcal 13 vaccine is administered at an interval of 8 weeks -5 days that dose #4 is not valid.

name: Dose 3 PCV 13 to dose 4 interval 8 wks-4 days.  Series complete.
text: This test case describes when dose #3 to dose #4 of the Pnuemococcal 13 vaccine is administered at an interval of 8 weeks -4 days that dose #4 is considered to be valid. The series is complete.

name: Dose 3 PCV 13 to dose 4 interval 8 weeks.  Series complete.
text: This test case describes when dose #3 to dose #4 of the Pnuemococcal 13 vaccine is administered at an interval of 8 weeks that dose #4 is considered to be valid. The series is complete.

name: Invalid dose 2 (interval) in midst of others
text: This test case describes when the second dose of the Pneumococcal vaccine is  not valid, but the patient is still complete since the last was after 12 months and 8 weeks from the previous dose.

name: Invalid dose 3 (interval) in midst of others
text: This test case describes when the third dose of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is  not valid, but the patient is still complete since the last dose was after 12 months of age and 8 weeks since the previous dose.

name: InValid dose 4 (interval) in midst of others
text: This test case describes when the fourth dose of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is  not valid.

name: Dose # 1 PCV 13 at age 6 weeks
text: This test case describes when the dose #1 of the Pneumococcal 13 vaccine is administered at age 6 weeks, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: 4 doses of PCV 7 and 1 dose of PCV 13=series complete
