text: This test case describes when dose #2 of a RotaTeq vaccine is administered at least 4 weeks - 4 days from dose #1 that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 Rotateq interval 28 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of a RotaTeq vaccine is administered at least 4 weeks from dose #1 that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose 2 to dose 3 Rotateq  interval 28-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #3 of a RotaTeq vaccine is administered at 4 weeks  - 5 days from dose #2 that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose 2 to dose 3 Rotateq interval  28-4 days
text: This test case describes when dose #3 of a RotaTeq vaccine is administered at 4 weeks  - 4 days from dose #2 that the dose is considered to be valid. The series is complete.

name: Dose 2 to dose 3 Rotateq interval 28 days
text: This test case describes when dose #3 of a RotaTeq vaccine is administered at, at least 14 weeks of age and at least 4 weeks (28 days) from dose #2, that the dose is considered to be valid. The series is complete.

name: Dose # 1 Rotarix at age 6 weeks-5 days
text: This test case describes when a Rotarix vaccine dose is administered at an age of 6 weeks - 5 days, that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose # 1 Rotarix at age 6 weeks-4 days
text: This test case describes when a Rotarix vaccine dose is administered at an age of 6 weeks - 4 days, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose # 1 Rotateq at age 6 weeks-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of the RotaTeq vaccine is administered at 6 weeks - 5 days that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose # 1 Rotarix at age 6 weeks
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of the Rotarix vaccine is administered at 6 weeks of age, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose # 2 Rotarix at age 10 weeks-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of Rotarix is administered at 10 weeks - 5 days of age that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose # 2 Rotarix at age 10 weeks-4 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of Rotarix is administered at 10 weeks - 4 days of age that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose # 2 Rotarix at age 10 weeks
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of Rotarix is administered at 10 weeks of age that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 Rotarix interval 28-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of Rotarix is administered at an interval of 28 - 5 days that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 Rotarix interval 28-4 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of Rotarix is administered at an interval of 28 - 4 days that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 Rotarix interval 28 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of Rotarix is administered at an interval of 28 days that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: ≥15 weeks old with no rota vax:  no forecast for rotavirus
text: This test case describes when a infant reaches 15 weeks of age at assessment, with no previous doses administered, that a Rotavirus vaccine should not be recommended. Patient is Aged Out.

name: Dose # 1 ≥ 15 weeks old
text: This test case describes when a infant has received dose #1 of a Rotavirus vaccine at age 15 weeks that dose #2 should be forecasted.

name: 8 months old with only one rota vax
text: This test case describes when an 8 month old infant was administered a previous dose of a Rotavirus vaccine at 3 months of age, that a second dose should be forecasted.

name: Dose # 1 Rotateq at age 6 weeks-4 days
text: This test case describes when an infant is administered a dose of RotaTeq at age 6 weeks - 4 days that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Rotateq at 2 months; rotarix at 4 mo
text: This test case describes when an infant is administered doses of RotaTeq at 2 and 4 months of age that the doses are considered to be valid.

name: Rotatrix at 2 mo; rotateq at 4 mo
text: This test case describes when an infant is administered a dose of Rotarix at 2 months of age and a dose of RotaTeq at 4 months of age that the doses are considered to be valid.

name: Unspecified rotavirus at 2 and 4 mo
text: This test case describes when an infant is administered doses of Unspecified Rotavirus vaccines at 2 and 4 months of age that the doses are considered to be valid. Forecast a third dose.

name: Dose # 1 Rotateq at age 6 weeks
text: This test case describes when an infant is administered a dose of RotaTeq at age 6 weeks, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose # 2 Rotateq at age 10 weeks-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of RotaTeq is administered at 10 weeks - 5 days of age that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose # 2 Rotateq at age 10 weeks-4 days
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of RotaTeq is administered at 10 weeks - 4 days of age that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose # 2 Rotateq at age 10 weeks
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of RotaTeq is administered at 10 weeks of age that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose # 3 Rotateq at age 14 weeks-5 days
text: This test case describes when dose #3 of RotaTeq vaccine is administered at 14 weeks - 5 days of age that the dose is not valid.

name: Dose # 3 Rotateq at age 14 weeks-4 days
text: This test case describes when dose #3 of RotaTeq vaccine is administered at 14 weeks - 4 days of age that the dose is considered to be valid.  The series is complete.

name: #1 at 15 months
text: This test case describes the administering of dose #1 of varicella at 15 months.

name: No doses of Varicella: current age 13Y -1D
text: This test case describes the forecasting of dose #1 of varicella at the age of 13 years - 1 day.

name: #1 at 1 year
text: This test case describes the administering of dose #1 of varicella at 12 months or 1 year of age.

name: # 1 at 12 months-5 days
text: This test case describes that the administering of dose #1 of varicella at 12 months - 5 days is considered not valid.

name: VAR # 1 at 12 months-4 days
text: This test case describes the administering of dose #1 of varicella at 12 months - 4 days to be considered as a valid dose.

name: Newborn forecasting
text: This test case describes the forecasting of dose #1 of varicella at 12 months of age for a newborn.

name: # 2 at age 13 years + 28 days
text: This test case describes when the second dose of the Varicella vaccine is administered at 13 years + 28 days that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28-1 days  in child < 13 years
text: This test case describes when the 2nd dose of varicella vaccine is administered at 28-1 day in a child < 13 years of age that the dose is considered not valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28 days  in child < 13 yrs old
text: This test case describes the administering of the 2nd dose of varicella 28 days after the first dose.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28-5 days  in child ≥ 13 yrs old
text: This test case describes when the 2nd dose of varicella vaccine is administered at 28-5 days after the 1st dose in a child that is 13 years of age that the dose is considered to be not valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28-4 days  in child ≥ 13 years old
text: This test case describes when the 2nd dose of varicella is administered at 28-4 days after the 1st dose in a child that is 13 years of age that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval 28 days in child ≥ 13 years old
text: This test case describes when the 2nd dose of varicella vaccine is administered at least 28 days after the first dose, in a child that is 13 years of age, that the dose is considered valid.

name: VZ and MMR given on same day at age 12 months
text: This test case describes that when two live virus vaccines (MMR and Varicella) are administered on the same date, that a second dose of the vaccines are recommended.

name: Doses 1 and 2 of VZ and MMR given at ages 12 months and 4 weeks later
text: This test case describes when dose #2 of the varicella vaccine is administered at less than 13 months of age, that the dose is considered to be invalid and a repeat dose should be administered at 12 weeks later.

name: MMR to VZ interval 28-1 day = invalid VZ.
text: This test case describes when a MMR vaccine is administered first and a Varicella vaccine is administered at 28-1 days after the MMR vaccine dose that the varicella vaccine dose is not valid.

name: MMR given at age 12 mo; VZ at age 12 mo+28 days
text: This test case describes when a MMR vaccine is administered at age 12 months and a Varicella vaccine is administered at 28 days later that the doses are valid and that a second dose of the varicella vaccine should be forecasted.

name: # 1 at age 12 mo-5 days
text: This test case describes when the first dose of the varicella vaccine is administered at 12 months - 5 days of age, that the vaccine dose is not valid.

name: # 1 MMRV at 12 m-5 days
text: This test case describes when a varicella vaccine (ProQuad) is administered at 12 months - 5 days of age, that the vaccine dose is not considered to be valid, and that the dose should be repeated.

name: # 1 MMRV at 12 m-4 days
text: This test case describes when the first dose of varicella vaccine (ProQuad) is administered at 12 months - 4 days of age, that it is considered to be valid, and a second dose should be forecasted.

name: # 1 MMRV at 12 months
text: This test case describes when the first dose of the varicella vaccine (PROQUAD) is administered at 12 months that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 MMRV interval 28 days in child < 15 months
text: This test case describes when the second dose of the varicella vaccine (PROQUAD)  is administered at 13 months + 28 days that the dose is considered valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 MMRV interval 28 days in child ≥ 15 months old=valid VZ
text: This test case describes when the second dose of the varicella vaccine (PROQUAD)  is administered at 15 months +11 days that the dose is considered valid.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 MMRV interval 28-1 days
text: This test case describes when the second dose of the varicella vaccine (PROQUAD)is administered at 28 - 1 days that the dose is not valid.

name: MMR to MMRV interval 28 days=valid VZ # 1
text: This test case describes when a MMR vaccine is given at 12 months and a MMRV (PROQUAD) vaccine is administered at one month later that the doses are considered to be valid.

name: MMR to MMRV interval 27 days=invalid as VZ # 1
text: This test case describes when a MMR vaccine is given at 12 months + 1 day and a MMRV (PROQUAD) vaccine is administered at one year and 28 days, that  that the MMR vaccine is not valid..

name: Dose 1 to dose 2  MMRV interval 12 weeks in child < 13 years old
text: This test case describes when the second dose of a MMR vaccine (PROQUAD) is administered > 28 days that the series is considered complete.

name: Dose 1 to dose 2 interval of 4 wks between VZ and MMRV in any age child=both valid
text: This test case describes when a MMRV (PROQUAD) vaccine is administered at least 4 week after a varicella vaccine dose that the Varicella two dose series is considered complete.

name: 28 day interval between invalid VZ and subsequent MMRV=valid VZ
text: This test case describes when a MMRV (PROQUAD) vaccine is administered at least 4 week after an invalid varicella vaccine dose that the PROQUAD vaccine dose is considered valid. Forecast dose 2.

name: Interval of < 24 days between an invalid VZ and a subsequent MMRV=not valid VZ
text: This test case describes when a MMRV (PROQUAD) vaccine is administered less than 24 days from an invalid dose of varicella vaccine dose, that the dose is not valid.  Forecast dose #1 of varicella vaccine.

name: LAIV given at age 3 years; VZ at age 3 years + 27 days
text: This test case describes when a varicella vaccine dose is administered at less than 28 days after an Influenza (LAIV) vaccine dose , that the Varicella dose is not valid.

name: LAIV given at age 3 years; VZ at age 3 years + 28 days
text: This test case describes when a Varicella vaccine is administered at least 28 days after an Influenza (LAIV) vaccine that the Varicella vaccine dose is considered to be valid. Forecast 2nd dose.

name: # 1 MMR at 12.5 mo; VZ not given=need 28 day interval for VZ
text: This test case describes when an MMR vaccine is administered at 12.5 months of age and Varicella wasn't, that a Varicella vaccine should be forecast 28 days later to provide proper live virus vaccine spacing.

name: # 2 at age 12 mo+ 4 Weeks
text: This test case describes when dose 2 of the Varicella vaccine is administered at less than 13 months of age, that the dose is not valid.

name: # 2 at age 15 mo.
text: This test case describes when the second dose of Varicella Vaccine is administered at age 15 months that the dose is considered valid and the series is complete.

name: # 1 at age ≥ 13 years old
text: This test case describes when a Varicella vaccine is administered at age 13 years that the  second dose is considered to be valid and a second dose should be forecasted at 4 weeks later.

name: Varicella: Zoster dose in lieu of  first dose of Varicella for adult patient
text: This test case describes when a ZVL vaccine dose is given in lieu of a Varicella vaccine to an adult less than 50 years, that the dose should be considered as a valid first dose of the Varicella vaccine.

name: Varicella: Adult patient has received 2 doses of the Varicella Vaccine at least 4 weeks apart
text: This test case describes when 2 dose of the Varicella vaccine has been administered to an Adult at least 4 weeks apart that the doses are considered valid and the series is complete.

name: Adult patient with no doses of the Varicella vaccine.
text: This test cases describes when an adult patient has not been administered any doses of the Varicella vaccine that the first dose should be forecast.

name: Adult patient with dose #2 at 4 weeks
text: This test cases describes when an adult patient has been administered the second dose of the Varicella vaccine at 4 weeks that no additional doses should be forecast.  Series is complete.

name: Adult patient with dose #2 at 4 weeks - 4 days
text: This test cases describes when an adult patient has been administered the second dose of the Varicella vaccine at 4 weeks - 4 days, that no additional doses should be forecast.  Series is complete.

name: Adult patient with dose #2 at 4 weeks - 5 days
text: This test cases describes when an adult patient has been administered the second dose of the Varicella vaccine at 4 weeks - 5 days, that another dose should be forecast.

name: Zoster: Zoster Dose administered at 50 years of age
text: This test case describes when a patient is administered ZVL at age 50 years, that the first dose of the RZV vaccine should be forecasted at 8 weeks later.

name: Zoster: Zoster Dose administered at 60 years of age
text: This test case describes when a patient is administered a dose of ZVL (Zostavax) at age 60 years, that the first dose of the RZV (Shingrix) vaccine should be forecasted.

name: Zoster: Patient is overdue at 62 years of age for Zoster dose
text: This test case describes when a patient is 62 years of age and has not been administered a Zoster vaccine, that dose 1 (Shingrix) of the 2 dose series should be forecasted.

name: Zoster: MMR to Zoster interval 28 days
text: This test case describes when a patient is administered a Zoster (ZVL) vaccine dose 28 days after a MMR vaccine dose, that the Zoster vaccine dose in considered valid. The engine should forecast dose #1 of the Zoster (Shingrix) vaccine.

name: Zoster: MMR to Zoster interval 28 - 1 days
text: This test case describes when a patient is in early 50's and is administered a Zoster vaccine dose 28 -1 days after a MMR vaccine dose that the ZVL (Zostavax) vaccine dose is considered invalid. Zoster should be forecast in the future.

name: Zoster: Patient has received dose 1 of the RZV (Shingrix) series
text: This test case describes when a patient is administered dose #1 of the RZV vaccine, that a second dose should be forecast.

name: Zoster: Dose #2 of the RZV (Shringrix) vaccine administered at two months after dose #1
text: This test case describes when a patient is administered dose #2 of the RZV vaccine at two months after dose #1, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Zoster: Dose #2 (Shingrix) administered at 4 weeks after dose #1
text: This test case describes when a patient is administered dose #2 of the RZV vaccine 4 weeks after the first dose that the series is considered complete.

name: Zoster: Dose #2 of Shingrix administered at one year after dose #1
text: This test case describes when an adult patient is administered the second dose, of the Shingrix vaccine, at one year later that the dose is considered to be valid. Series is complete.

name: Zoster: Dose #2 (Shingrix) administered at 4 weeks - 1 days after dose #1
text: This test case describes when an adult patient is administered the second dose of Shingrix vaccine at 4 weeks - 1 day, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Zoster: Patient is 50 with no previous history of Shringrix vaccine
text: This test case describes when a patient is age 50 that dose 1 of the Shringrix vaccine should be forecasted.

name: Zoster: Dose #1 of RZV administered 4 weeks after previous dose of ZVL
text: This test case describes when a patient is administered the first dose of RZV (Shingrix) at 4 weeks after a previous dose of ZVL (Zostavax), that the dose is considered valid. Per current guidance, RZV is recommended to be spaced 8 weeks after ZVL, but it does not need to be repeated if administered at any point prior to that 8 weeks up to and including the same day.

name: Zoster: ZVL and RZV (Shingrix) vaccine doses administered on the same day/time
text: This test case describes when a patient receives a dose of ZVL (Shingrix)  and RZV (Zostavax) on the same day, that the doses are considered to be valid.

name: Zoster: Dose #1 of Shingrix 8 weeks after Dose #2 of Varicella vaccine
text: This test case describes when a patient is administered a dose of Zoster (Shingrix) vaccine 8 weeks after the second dose of Varicella vaccine, that the doses are considered to be valid.

name: Zoster: Dose #1 of Shingrix, 4 weeks after Dose #2 of Varicella vaccine
text: This test case describes when dose #1 of the Shingrix vaccine is administered less than 8 weeks after the 2nd dose of the Varicella vaccine that the doses are considered to be valid.

name: Zoster: Dose #1 of RZV administered 8 weeks after previous dose of ZVL
text: This test case describes when an adult patient is administered the first dose of RZV 8 weeks after a previous dose of ZVL, that the dose is valid.

name: Zoster: Patient has received all three doses of the zoster vaccine
text: This test case describes when an adult patient receives three (valid) doses of the Zoster vaccine that the series is considered Complete.

name: Zoster: Dose #2 (Shingrix) administered at 4 weeks - 5 days after dose #1
text: This test case describes that when a patient is administered the second dose of Shingrix vaccine at less than 4 weeks - 4 days, that the dose is considered not valid.

name: Zoster: Dose #2 (Shingrix) administered at 4 weeks - 4 days after dose #1
text: This test case describes that when a patient is administered the second dose of Shingrix vaccine at 4 weeks - 4 day, that the dose is considered to be valid.

name: Zoster: Dose #1 of RZV administered 0 Days after previous dose of ZVL
text: This test case describes when an adult patient is administered the first dose of RZV 0 days after a previous dose of ZVL, that the doses are valid.
